channel.title: Exercise 2: Watchlist on English
channel.description: Recent content in Exercise 2: Watchlist on English

item.title: Step 1: Examine Source Data
item.description:
Examine the Source Data

Overview

Examine the watchlist JSON data to understand its structure. Unlike the CSV format in Exercise 1, this data uses the FollowTheMoney (FTM) schema with nested structures.

Locate the Source Data

The watchlist data is located at:

/home/ubuntu/workshop/workspace/watchlist/watchlist.jsonl

Examine the Data

TODO: Instructions for examining the JSON file will go here.

Placeholder for:

  • Opening the file in the IDE
  • Understanding JSONL format (one JSON object per line)
  • Reviewing the FTM schema structure
  • Looking at sample entities
  • Identifying nested fields and relationships

Expected observations:

item.title: Step 2: Create Schema
item.description:
Provide or Create the Schema

Overview

Document the schema for the watchlist JSON data. The schema generator can help analyze the FTM format and create a schema document.

Using the Schema Generator

TODO: Instructions for running the schema generator will go here.

Placeholder for:

  • Running sz_schema_generator.py on the watchlist JSONL
  • Reviewing the generated schema output
  • Understanding nested field structures
  • Noting FTM-specific attributes
  • Saving the schema for reference

Command:

python3 ~/workshop/senzing/tools/sz_schema_generator.py \
  ~/workshop/workspace/watchlist/watchlist.jsonl

Expected output:

item.title: Step 3: Map the Schema
item.description:
Use the Senzing Mapping Assistant

Overview

Use the Senzing Mapping Assistant prompt with Amazon Q to map the watchlist data. This follows the same 5-stage workflow but with JSON input instead of CSV.

The 5-Stage Workflow

The Mapping Assistant guides you through:

  1. INIT - Load reference files and verify tools
  2. INVENTORY - Analyze source data schema
  3. PLANNING - Determine data source and entity types
  4. MAPPING - Map fields to Senzing features
  5. OUTPUTS - Generate mapper script and documentation

Start the Mapping Assistant

Prompt to use:

item.title: Step 8: Review Examples
item.description:
Review with MCP Server

Overview

Use the Senzing MCP Server to explore cross-dataset resolution results. Focus on understanding how customer records matched against watchlist entities.

Using the MCP Server

Query the combined dataset to understand cross-dataset resolution decisions.
